---
title: Introduction to Math and Stats

**Prerequisites**

::: columns
::: {.column width="30%"}
![](images/bookcover.jpeg)
:::

::: {.column width="5%"}
:::

::: {.column width="65%"}
Before starting this module make sure you have:

-   access to the book *Nield, T. (2022). Essential Math for Data Science. O'Reilly Media, Inc.*

-   a data science environment [setup](https://businessdatasolutions.github.io/datamining-course/book/setup.html){target="_blank"}

In case you have not yet set up your environment you can use online notebook services like [Google Colab](https://youtu.be/inN8seMm7UI){target="_blank"} or [JupyterLab](https://jupyter.org/try-jupyter/lab/?path=notebooks%2FIntro.ipynb){target="_blank"} or [Replit](https://replit.com/){target="_blank"}
:::
:::

**Purpose**

The general learning outcome of this course is:

> The student is able to perform a well-defined task independently in a relatively clearly arranged situation, or is able to perform in a complex and unpredictable situation under supervision.

After studying this course, you should be able to:

-   Relate set theory to the concept of probability

<!-- -->

-   Interpret, modify and sketch mathematical operations

-   Compute and solve mathematical equations

-   Compute, manipulate, solve and plot mathematical functions

-   Use Python or other data science script languages
